learning_outcomes.description: Apply the concept of linear regression to data and interpret results.
Critically evaluate underlying theories, concepts, assumptions and arguments in econometrics.
Conduct inference using OLS with one variable and multiple variables in analysing real-world data.
Extend the linear regression framework to FE estimators, instrumental variables, and nonlinear regression analysis in the estimation of econometric models.
Communicate (with potential users) econometric analysis by tables and figures with proper interpretation and policy recommendations.

assessments.due_date: Due during the tutorials in weeks 3,4,5, and 7-13.
assessments.task_description:
7 best out of 10 quizzes which will take place in person during the tutorials in weeks 3, 4, 5, and 7-13. Each quiz takes the form of multiple choice question(s) checking that the concepts covered in the lectures and tutorials up the previous week have been understood.

As these tests require to be taken in person, it is essential that you enrol in a tutorial slot that you can really attend. The final mark of this assessment item is the best 7 out of 10 quizzes, please do not contact us if you cannot make up your regular tutorial. You could check if there is a seat at another tutorial if you exceptionally cannot attend your regular one but do not wish to miss a test. Enrolled students in a class will always have priority.

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. The use of any electronic device will not be permitted. Students are allowed to bring one A4 sheet of written notes. Students will need to place their student ID on their desk space for the tutor to verify while they are completing the task.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Students must place their ID on the table during the quiz for the tutor to verify their identity. The quiz must be completed during the tutorial. The gradescope bubble sheet to be handed to the tutor before leaving the tutorial room.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.late_submission: You will receive a mark of 0 if this assessment is submitted late.
assessments.additional_info: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.

assessments.assessment_title: Project: Assignment and Brief Research Report
assessments.due_date:
28/04/2026 4:00 pm

The project can be submitted at anytime before the due date.
assessments.task_description:
You are expected to formulate hypothesis relevant to a research project. Analyse the data using techniques covered under the Learning Objectives as indicated above. Submit a research report summarising your findings and offering policy advice based on your findings.

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance.

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Students are required to submit an electronic copy through the course webpage (Blackboard).
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
This is a closed book exam (one A4 single sided sheet of written or typed notes permitted) to be sat in a designated examination room at the St Lucia campus. The exam is comprehensive. However, emphasis will be on:

  • Regression with Panel Data
  • Regression with Binary Dependent Variable
  • Instrumental Variables Regression
  • Experiments and Quasi-Experiments
  • Big Data

Please note UQ's policy on approved calculators that can be brought into examination rooms: https://my.uq.edu.au/services/manage-my-program/exams-and-assessment/sitting-exam/approved-calculators

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

learning_activities.topic:
Introduction

Introduction to econometrics; review of statistical concepts; introduction to R.

Learning outcomes: L02
learning_activities.topic_description: Introduction Introduction to econometrics; review of statistical concepts; introduction to R.

learning_activities.topic:
Linear Regression with One Regressor

the linear regression model; estimating the coefficients; measure of fit; the least squares assumptions; sampling distribution of the OLS estimator.

Learning outcomes: L01
learning_activities.topic_description: Linear Regression with One Regressor the linear regression model; estimating the coefficients; measure of fit; the least squares assumptions; sampling distribution of the OLS estimator.

learning_activities.topic:
Single Regressor Models: Inference

testing hypotheses about one of the regression coefficients; confidence intervals for a regression coefficient; dummy variable regressors; heteroskedasticity and homoskedasticity; foundations of OLS; t-statistics and sample size.

Learning outcomes: L02, L03
learning_activities.topic_description: Single Regressor Models: Inference testing hypotheses about one of the regression coefficients; confidence intervals for a regression coefficient; dummy variable regressors; heteroskedasticity and homoskedasticity; foundations of OLS; t-statistics and sample size.

learning_activities.topic:
Linear Regression with Multiple Regressors

omitted variable bias; the multiple regression model; the OLS estimator in multiple regression; measure of fit in multiple regression; the least squares assumption in multiple regression; the distribution of the OLS estimator in the multiple regression; multicollinearity.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03
learning_activities.topic_description: Linear Regression with Multiple Regressors omitted variable bias; the multiple regression model; the OLS estimator in multiple regression; measure of fit in multiple regression; the least squares assumption in multiple regression; the distribution of the OLS estimator in the multiple regression; multicollinearity.

learning_activities.topic:
Multiple Regression: Inference

hypothesis tests and confidence intervals for single coefficient; tests of joint hypotheses; testing single restrictions involving multiple coefficients; model specification for multiple regression; case study: test score data.

Learning outcomes: L02, L03
learning_activities.topic_description: Multiple Regression: Inference hypothesis tests and confidence intervals for single coefficient; tests of joint hypotheses; testing single restrictions involving multiple coefficients; model specification for multiple regression; case study: test score data.

learning_activities.topic:
Nonlinear Regression Functions

a general strategy for modeling nonlinear regression functions; nonlinear functions of a single independent variable; interactions between independent variables; case study: nonlinear effects on test scores.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03
learning_activities.topic_description: Nonlinear Regression Functions a general strategy for modeling nonlinear regression functions; nonlinear functions of a single independent variable; interactions between independent variables; case study: nonlinear effects on test scores.

learning_activities.topic:
Assessing Studies Based on Multiple Regression

internal and external validity; threats to internal validity of multiple regression analysis; internal and external validity when the regression is used for forecasting; case study: test scores and class size.

Learning outcomes: L02, L03, L05
learning_activities.topic_description: Assessing Studies Based on Multiple Regression internal and external validity; threats to internal validity of multiple regression analysis; internal and external validity when the regression is used for forecasting; case study: test scores and class size.

learning_activities.topic:
Regression with Panel Data

description and examples of panel data; panel data with two time periods; fixed effects regression; regression with time fixed effects; the fixed effects regression assumptions and standard errors for fixed effects regression; case study: drunk driving laws and traffic deaths.

Learning outcomes: L03, L04, L05
learning_activities.topic_description: Regression with Panel Data description and examples of panel data; panel data with two time periods; fixed effects regression; regression with time fixed effects; the fixed effects regression assumptions and standard errors for fixed effects regression; case study: drunk driving laws and traffic deaths.

learning_activities.topic:
Regression with a Binary Dependent Variable

binary dependent variable and the linear probability model; probit and logit regression; estimation and inference in the probit and logit models; case study: Boston HDMA data.

Learning outcomes: L03, L04, L05
learning_activities.topic_description: Regression with a Binary Dependent Variable binary dependent variable and the linear probability model; probit and logit regression; estimation and inference in the probit and logit models; case study: Boston HDMA data.

learning_activities.topic:
Instrumental Variables Regression

the IV estimator with a single regressor and a single instrument; the general IV regression model; checking instrument validity; finding valid instruments; case study: demand for cigarettes.

Learning outcomes: L03, L04, L05
learning_activities.topic_description: Instrumental Variables Regression the IV estimator with a single regressor and a single instrument; the general IV regression model; checking instrument validity; finding valid instruments; case study: demand for cigarettes.

learning_activities.topic:
Experiments and Quasi-Experiments

potential outcomes, causal effects, and idealized experiments; threats to validity of experiments; quasi-experiments and potential problems; case study: effect of class size reductions.

Learning outcomes: L03, L04, L05
learning_activities.topic_description: Experiments and Quasi-Experiments potential outcomes, causal effects, and idealized experiments; threats to validity of experiments; quasi-experiments and potential problems; case study: effect of class size reductions.

learning_activities.topic:
Big Data

OLS with many regressors; predictive regression model; oracle prediction; shrinkage; ridge regression; the lasso; principal components analysis
learning_activities.topic_description: Big Data OLS with many regressors; predictive regression model; oracle prediction; shrinkage; ridge regression; the lasso; principal components analysis
